text:
Hi <@U8THBCFC4> (happy Monday!). I just got off a great call with <@UHE8JR508> who's a smart developer about to embark on building their first website on HubSpot CMS.

He asked me if <#CES6JU0RY|drag-drop-email-beta> functionality was available for pages... I said "You NEED to meet Katie!" haha. :slightly_smiling_face:

Could you please get Sam into the closed beta and help answer a few questions he has? :pray::pray::pray:
One question that did come up - that I'm curious on too - What considerations or functionality loss happens when a developers uses Bootstrap 3/4 or their own grid framework, <@U8THBCFC4>?
There is no functionality loss, we adapt our frameworks css to override the built in bootstrap 2 grid css
so columns and whatnot translate to the framework we want to use.
Yep, definitely! Reaching out to you separately <@UHE8JR508>.
:slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks all
So are you saying I can use any grid framework I want and it will work with the drag and drop functionality?
Columns, rows, etc?

yes, as long as you modify the framework files you have to support the bootstrap class names in addition to their original class names. (you don’t have to edit the original files you could just have the corrections in your main stylesheet you’re loading in addition to the framework.

example:
`.col-md-1{/*styles*/}`
becomes
`.span1,.col-md-1{/*styles*/}`

basically just need to map the class names to fit the framework you’re going to use. If you’re using a framework that doesn’t use 12 columns, it will be a little harder to make it work great but still possible
Oh, so I just need to override the Bootstrap 2 CSS?
but keep and use the classes

yep. The styles are really light in their bootstrap 2 grid, it’s not full bootstrap or anything, just basically the grid with nothing else no positiong classes or anything so it doesn’t take much work
Got it
Thanks!
Interesting, does that then mean I could do that with the normal drag and drop template editor as well?

yep.

The only area this isn’t going to work is in emails, they use a different HS custom framework for that.
Ok, that's great news!

we’re working on a framework purpose built for HS development if you’re interested, basic idea is to be like bootstrap or foundation, but utilize HubSpot’s unique capabilities.  Still early days but: <https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft>

the project hasn’t had a lot of recent updates but it’s not dead, I just haven’t had the time to write up clear issues to guide people on how to help.
I'll check it out
Interesting…:ear:
